title: nbdev-hello-world
text: This file will become your README and also the index of your documentation.

title: nbdev-hello-world
text:
Dev Env Setup

Git clone the project
pip install nbdev - this is for the global pip, not within the project virtualenv
install quarto - if you try nbdev_install_quarto on Command Line, it will install Quarto or give you the link to download Quarto CLI
Restart VSCode and try running nbdev_prepare - there should NOT be any errors
Run nbdev_preview to start the documentation web server - this will open a preview of the docs generated from the notebooks
Install VS Code extension nbdev
Modify some notebook file and save - you should get a message about cleaned notebook - this is the extension running nbdev_clean to get rid of unwanted metadata. Check whether the docs preview is updated with your change.
Each time you change the notebook, do a Run All - this will ensure that the corresponding code files are generated
Run nbdev_prepare before each commit.
Check the diff in Git Diff view - you should see a meaningful diff - commit the changes and do a git push to test whether CI/CD workflow is working.
Open index notebook and do a Run All - you will get an error that the module nbdev-hello-world is NOT found
do pip install -e ".[dev]" from the project folder root - this should install the package in dev mode
Run All on index notebook to check whether the error is gone.
